page.title: 11All Saints Church,Lt. Kimble
page.content: The Church is 700 years old and built medieval period, it is famous for its wall paintings for which the Kimble parochial curch council are the trustees. It's likely that the walls were coverd with paintings of saints including St. Laurence, St. Francis, St. George and St. Bernard who is not normaly heard of in England. The Church is set in a lovely rural setting in the Chiltern hills. It also has a tower with two bells. There is a painting of St. George and the Princess. The paintings in the Church were not just made for decoration but for learning as well because most people in the Medieval period could not read. All Saints is made from flint. Rev. David Horner is now the rector of the church. The bell tower is 7-8 metres high.
